articles.author: Generatecode
articles.description:
Introduction
When developing a game in OpenGL, you may encounter a myriad of issues, particularly when it comes to collision detection. One common issue is related to ray intersection tests with triangles when box collision is enabled. You may find that your triangle ray intersection code works correctly without additional collision logic but fails as soon as you introduce box collision checks. In this article, we will explore why this happens and how you can resolve it.
Understanding the Issue
The interplay between different types of collision detection methods, such as box and triangle collisions, can lead to unexpected behavior in your game logic. In the provided code snippet, the triangle ray intersection logic stops working when an additional conditional check related to box collision‚Ä¶
articles.title: Why Does My OpenGL Triangle Ray Intersection Fail with Box Collision?

articles.description:
This is a submission for the Amazon Q Developer "Quack The Code" Challenge: Crushing the Command Line
Each month, I had various devices that were not prepared to update the scripts for updating the applications and systems. Searching for the appropriate commands may take time. I remembered the tasks that I should do, but unfortunately forgot the scripts or commands. Let's ask Amazon Q for help to prepare the scripts.
Updating essential apps, for example, AWS CLI.
First Simple Prompt

First Simple Prompt Verification

Cleaning caches
Second Simple Prompt

Second Simple Prompt Verification

Back up the scripts into a directory and/or a repository.
Moving the scripts

Adding the context and creating a README

Well, I can also create the repository on GitHub without leaving the chat! Awesome!
‚Ä¶
articles.title: Amazon Q: Assisting with My Monthly Maintenance

articles.author: NJOKU SAMSON EBERE
articles.description:
Asynchronous JavaScript can be tricky to grasp, especially for beginners. Concepts like Promises, Async/Await, and the fetch API often seem abstract ‚Äî until you build something real with them.
In my latest YouTube video, I break down asynchronous JS in the simplest way possible and walk you through how to use it in a real-world project. And what better way to learn than by building something fun‚Ä¶ like a Pok√©mon Fetch App!








  
  
  üìå What You'll Learn


‚úÖ The difference between Promises and Async/Await

‚úÖ How to use try...catch and finally for error handling

‚úÖ Making real API requests with the fetch() method

‚úÖ Applying everything by building a Pok√©mon project
00:00 ‚Äì Introduction: What is Asynchronous JavaScript?


01:10 ‚Äì Promises, Async/Await, try‚Ä¶catch, then‚Ä¶catch‚Ä¶finally


06:30 ‚Äì API - Fetch


10:39 ‚Äì Pok√©mon Project (Hands-on section)
If you're learning frontend development or JavaScript, mastering asynchronous code is non-negotiable. Whether you're handling user interactions, loading data from an API, or building full-stack apps ‚Äî you need these concepts in your toolkit.
This video blends theory and practice, so you'll understand the "why" and "how" behind the code ‚Äî not just copy-paste your way through.
In the final part of the video, you'll build a simple app that fetches Pok√©mon data from a public API. You‚Äôll apply everything you‚Äôve learned and see how it all works together.
Don't just read about async JavaScript ‚Äî build it.

üëâ Click here to watch the full video
If you find the video helpful, please consider:  
Liking üëç

Subscribing üîî

Sharing it with friends or dev communities üí¨







  
  
  üè∑Ô∏è Tags



  
  
  JavaScript #AsyncAwait #Promises #WebDevelopment #Frontend #FetchAPI #LearnToCode #JavaScriptProject #CodingTutorial #Pok√©monAPI
articles.title: Master Asynchronous JavaScript: Promises, Async/Await, Fetch API + Pok√©mon Project

articles.author: Jowen Kace
articles.description:
Choosing the right packaging material for your product is more than just a design or cost decision‚Äîit's a reflection of your brand's values, product needs, and customer expectations. For many businesses, the choice often comes down to two of the most common materials: plastic or paper.
Both have their pros and cons, and neither is universally better in every situation. In this blog, we‚Äôll explore the key factors you should consider when deciding between plastic and paper packaging, especially as sustainability and consumer awareness continue to shape the packaging industry.
As global concerns about climate change and plastic pollution grow, businesses are under increasing pressure to adopt sustainable packaging solutions. Consumers are now more informed and are actively seeking products wi‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to Choose Between Plastic and Paper Packaging

articles.author: Anthony Jekanyika
articles.description:
Panier is a system built for small business with features including Point of Sale, Invoices, Credit Notes, Debit Notes, Delivery Notes, Quotations, Multi-Currency, Stock Management, Profit and Loss and much more. Panier also includes the ability to ZIMRA Fiscalize and extends this ability to the Panier API allowing you to integrate with it from your project. In this article we will show you how you can integrate your project with ZIMRA's FDMS through the Panier API.
First you need to register an account on Panier and create a company if you don't already have one. You will get a 14 day FREE trial when you register, after which you will have to pay a US$19.99 monthly subscription for each company that you have.
Next navigate to the Developer API page of your company and generate the API Cre‚Ä¶
articles.title: ZIMRA Fiscalisation with the Panier API: A Step-by-Step Guide

articles.author: Piotr Pabis
articles.description:
LDAP is a pretty known and widely used protocol in the world of IT, although it is not as comfortable to use as OAuth or OpenID Connect. Nevertheless, you can still often encounter enterprises that need to use it, therefore it is worth to gain some experience with it. In this article, I will show you how to set up a website on Nginx that is protected by Active Directory or LDAP authentication. If you have your own spare domain, you are even luckier because you can also use SSL from Let's Encrypt to make the connection secure (see last section)!
The code for the complete project is available on GitHub: https://github.com/ppabis/nginx-ldap-simplead
In order to use LDAP with Nginx, we obviously need a directory where our users will reside. For this purpose, I will use AWS Simple AD, as it is ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Website behind Active Directory/LDAP with Nginx

articles.author: Alex Enson
articles.description:
In the final part of the scripting series, we will be a looking at a real world example of a system health script you can run in your production environment.
This type of script is a powerful tool for both new and seasoned Linux users, offering a quick and automated snapshot of a system's health. It combines key administrative tasks - like checking uptime, disk usage, system load, user activity, and log data - into a single, readable report. Whether you're a student learning Bash, a sysadmin managing servers, or a DevOps engineer monitoring resources, this script saves time, reduces manual effort, and builds a habit of proactive system checks. It‚Äôs not just a script - it‚Äôs a hands-on learning experience and a real-world productivity booster.


Create the script in VIM.



Write the script ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Scripting Series ‚Äì Part 8 of 8

articles.author: Akash Roy
articles.description:
If you‚Äôre diving into DevOps, sooner or later you‚Äôll find yourself working with cloud infrastructure. And when it comes to enterprises, Azure is one of the biggest players in the game. But for many newcomers, Azure can feel like a maze of services, menus, and jargon.
This post breaks down how to get started with Azure practically ‚Äî with just enough context to understand what's happening, and a CLI-driven walkthrough to create your first resource group.
At its core, Microsoft Azure is a cloud computing platform that offers:
On-demand access to computing, storage, networking, and AI services
A pay-as-you-go model
Massive global scale
Whether you‚Äôre hosting a web app, spinning up Kubernetes clusters, or building a DevOps pipeline ‚Äî Azure has a service for it.
Before we dive in, let‚Äôs get clea‚Ä¶
articles.title: Azure 101: Getting Started with Azure Cloud

articles.author: Team Timescale
articles.description:
In case you missed the quiet launch of our timescaledb-ruby gem, we‚Äôre here to remind you that you can now connect PostgreSQL and Ruby when using TimescaleDB. üéâ This integration delivers a deeply integrated experience that will feel natural to Ruby and Rails developers.
If you‚Äôve worked with Rails for any length of time, you‚Äôve probably hit the wall when dealing with time-series data. I know I did. 
Your app starts off smooth‚Äîcollecting metrics, logging events, tracking usage. But one day, your dashboards start lagging. Page load times creep past 10 seconds. Pagination stops helping. Background jobs queue up as yesterday‚Äôs data takes too long to process.
This isn‚Äôt a Rails problem. Or even a PostgreSQL problem. It‚Äôs a ‚Äúusing the wrong tool for the job‚Äù problem.
In this post, I‚Äôll show you‚Ä¶
articles.title: Your Rails App Isn‚Äôt Slow‚ÄîYour Database Is

articles.author: Cointelegraph by William Suberg
articles.description:
Key points:

Bitcoin is struggling again as gold retakes the limelight with week-to-date gains of nearly 5%.

Bitcoin‚Äôs correlation with gold is under scrutiny amid ongoing macroeconomic shifts.

Traders see a short-term slump amid a wider BTC price rebound.

Bitcoin (BTC) eyed fresh month-to-date lows into the May 6 Wall Street open as ‚Äúdirectionless‚Äù crypto markets contrasted with a gold rebound.
BTC/USD 1-hour chart. Source: Cointelegraph/TradingView
Analysis: Bitcoin, crypto ‚Äúlargely directionless‚Äù
Data from Cointelegraph Markets Pro and TradingView showed BTC price momentum stalling at $95,000 before the latest daily close.¬†
Inching closer to the key yearly open support level at $93,500, BTC/USD appeared caught in limbo while gold returned to outperform.
XAU/USD was up 1.5% on the day‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin risks sub-$92K retest as BTC price fails to match 4% gold gains

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Biraajmaan Tamuly
articles.description:
Key takeaways: 

Bitcoin‚Äôs Coinbase premium index turned negative for the first time in 15 days, indicating defensive short-term sentiment among US investors.

Bitcoin CME futures gaps between support at $92,000-$92,500 and resistance at $96,400-$97,400 suggest a period of range-bound trading. 

Bitcoin‚Äôs Coinbase premium index, which measures the gap between BTC price at Coinbase Pro and Binance exchange, turned negative after a 15-day positive stint, signaling potential bearish sentiment among US investors.
This drop coincides with Bitcoin (BTC) slipping below $94,000, and the premium‚Äôs decline suggests reduced buying pressure on Coinbase, which is viewed as a proxy for both institutional and retail demand.
Bitcoin Coinbase premium. Source: CryptoQuant
Cointelegraph reported early signs ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin price forms two BTC futures gaps after Coinbase premium flips negative

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ezra Reguerra
articles.description:
While blockchain infrastructure may be ready for institutional use, many legal teams at large firms remain cautious about full integration with the technology.¬†
At the Token2049 event in Dubai, DoubleZero Labs founder and former Solana head of strategy Austin Federa told Cointelegraph that today's high-performance blockchains like Solana are technically capable of supporting large-scale institutional usage. However, lawyers still need to catch up.¬†
‚ÄúMost blockchains nowadays, especially things like Solana, are fast enough for institutions to use them,‚Äù Federa said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs really more about the institutions and the institution‚Äôs lawyers getting comfortable with crypto.‚Äù
Federa added that institutional lawyers and compliance teams are still addressing regulatory concerns. The executive said t‚Ä¶
articles.title: Blockchains ready for institutions, lawyers hesitate: DoubleZero CEO

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
Investment bank¬†Citi¬†and Switzerland‚Äôs SIX Digital Exchange (SDX) are teaming up to modernize traditional private markets through tokenization.
The initiative, revealed during the Point Zero Forum in Switzerland, will leverage SDX‚Äôs blockchain-based Central Securities Depositary (CSD) platform to tokenize, settle, and safekeep assets, according to a May 6 announcement.
The platform, expected to go live by the third quarter of 2025, will make late-stage, pre-initial public offering (IPO) equities accessible to institutional and eligible investors globally.
For issuers, the project offers a compliant and scalable framework to manage liquidity, particularly for early investors and employees, while maintaining cap table control. For investors, it opens access to high-growth, venture-backed com‚Ä¶
articles.title: Citi and SDX partner to tokenize traditional private markets

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Adrian Zmudzinski
articles.description:
Decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) HydraDAO claims that its researchers were able to use a novel technique to repair severed spines in rats.
In a May 5 X post, decentralized science (DeSci) project HydraDAO said that one of its research projects resulted in ‚Äúrats who had their spines fully transected‚Äù being able to walk again. More notably, recovery from surgery reportedly only took five days.
Source: HydraDAO
The post featured a video of partially shaved (presumably due to surgery) rats walking in what appeared to be a laboratory setting. The effort in question is the Dowell spinal fusogens project led by Michael Lebenstein-Gumovski, which raised 380,700 USDC (USDC) from donors. The dedicated HydraDAO page reads:
‚ÄúThe Dowell team submitted a project proposal to HydraDAO. After ca‚Ä¶
articles.title: Research DAO claims paralyzed rats recover after spinal cord fix

articles.description:
Key takeaways:

Berkshire holds $347B in cash, enough to buy ~18% of Bitcoin‚Äôs supply.

Greg Abel has not signaled a shift from Warren Buffett‚Äôs anti-Bitcoin stance.

Berkshire already has indirect crypto exposure via Nu Holdings, Jefferies.

Warren Buffett announced at Berkshire Hathaway's annual shareholder meeting on May 3 that he will step down as CEO by the end of 2025, with Greg Abel taking over. This transition raises speculation about Berkshire‚Äôs financial capacity to purchase Bitcoin (BTC) under the new leadership.
Source: Discover Crypto
Berkshire can easily surpass Strategy‚Äôs BTC stash 
Berkshire ended Q4 2024 with a record $347 billion in cash and US Treasury bills, representing about 32% of its $1.1 trillion market capitalization. 
The company could acquire approximately 3.52 ‚Ä¶
articles.title: How much Bitcoin can Berkshire Hathaway buy?

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Shailey Singh
articles.description:
What is the Paws Telegram Mini App?            
            
                
Paws is a Telegram-based Mini App created by the same team behind other projects, such as Notcoin and Dogs.¬†
If you‚Äôve been cruising around Telegram lately, chances are you‚Äôve stumbled upon Paws, the viral crypto Mini App that‚Äôs got everyone tapping, clicking and inviting their friends like it‚Äôs 2010 FarmVille all over again.¬†
Originally launched in October 2024 on The Open Network (TON) blockchain, Paws exploded in popularity with its ultra-simple tap-to-earn concept. Think of it as a gamified rewards engine embedded directly in Telegram, where users rack up points by completing tasks, referring others and interacting with mini-game elements.¬†
Within just eight days of going live, Paws pulled in over 20 million ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Is the Paws Telegram mini app legit? What you need to know

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ezra Reguerra
articles.description:
Petr Kozyakov, CEO of crypto payments platform Mercuryo, told Cointelegraph that the future of finance may not be a winner-takes-all scenario but a blend of digital assets and fiat, each used where it makes the most sense.¬†
In a Cointelegraph interview, Kozyakov said that while crypto payments are seeing an increase in adoption and demand, the asset class won‚Äôt be fully replacing fiat money anytime soon. He said the two asset classes will coexist, with people choosing the more convenient payment option in different situations.¬†
‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt think crypto will replace fiat,‚Äù Kozyakov told Cointelegraph. ‚ÄúThey will coexist, and people will turn to crypto when it‚Äôs the easier, more practical option, whether that‚Äôs for payroll, yield or money transfers.‚Äù
Mercuryo Petr Kozyakov at the Token2049 eve‚Ä¶
articles.title: Crypto spending will grow, but fiat isn‚Äôt going anywhere: Mercuryo CEO

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
Veteran US Internal Revenue Service (IRS) official Trish Turner was appointed to lead the agency‚Äôs digital assets division following the departure of two key crypto-focused executives.
Turner, who has spent over 20 years at the IRS and most recently served as a senior adviser within the Digital Assets Office, will now head the unit, according to a report from Bloomberg Tax citing a person familiar with the situation.
Her promotion marks a significant leadership transition at a time when US crypto tax enforcement is facing both internal and external pressures.
On May 5, Sulolit ‚ÄúRaj‚Äù Mukherjee and Seth Wilks, two private-sector experts brought in to lead the IRS‚Äôs crypto unit, exited after roughly a year in their roles.
Mukherjee served as compliance and implementation executive director, w‚Ä¶
articles.title: IRS appoints Trish Turner to head crypto division amid resignations

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ezra Reguerra
articles.description:
The CEO of crypto exchange OKX‚Äôs Middle East and North Africa (MENA) division has called on the industry to prioritize real-world utility as interest in tokenizing real-world assets (RWAs) continues to grow.
In a Cointelegraph interview at the Token20249 event in Dubai, OKX MENA CEO Rifad Mahasneh warned that while tokenization is promising, projects must ‚Äúclearly demonstrate‚Äù the benefits of tokenizing specific assets.¬†
‚ÄúIn some cases, we‚Äôre tokenizing things that don‚Äôt need tokenization, but in some cases, we‚Äôre tokenizing things that actually give you real, everyday value, right? And if you can see that everyday value, then that is a promising project,‚Äù Mahasneh told Cointelegraph.
He said hype can drive project growth in the Web3 space, but providing everyday value should be the priori‚Ä¶
articles.title: OKX exec warns against hype amid real-world asset tokenization boom

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Simon Cain
articles.description:
Opinion by: Simon Cain, contributor at Bitcoin Policy UK
Most jurisdictions globally are researching, developing or implementing retail central bank digital currencies (CBDCs). If you see these as harmless move-with-the-times digital updates of old-fashioned paper money, look again. CBDCs potentially mean financial serfdom via a monetary panopticon where the authorities closely control every transaction.¬†
If you think this sounds paranoid, just consider the words of Augustin Carstens, head of the Bank for International Settlements ‚Äî the central bank for the world‚Äôs central banks. Lamenting the authorities‚Äô current inability to control cash transactions, he says that with a CBDC, a ‚Äúcentral bank will have absolute control on the rules and regulations that will determine use... also we will ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin vs. digital fiat is freedom vs. serfdom

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
Efforts to pass crypto legislation in the US Senate face mounting resistance amid growing ethical concerns around US President Donald Trump‚Äôs ties to crypto.
In a May 5 letter to the Office of Government Ethics, Senators Elizabeth Warren and Jeff Merkley said that Trump and his family stand to personally profit from an investment involving UAE state-backed firm MGX, crypto exchange Binance and World Liberty Financial (WLFI).
The senators called for an urgent probe, warning the deal may violate the US Constitution‚Äôs Emoluments Clause and federal bribery statutes.
At the center of the controversy is WLFI‚Äôs USD1 stablecoin, reportedly chosen for a $2 billion investment MGX plans to make into Binance.
The senators said the transaction amounts to a potential backdoor for foreign influence and s‚Ä¶
articles.title: US Senate crypto bills stall amid Trump ties and ethics concerns

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
Bitcoin Core developers have decided to remove a limit on transaction data in the next network upgrade, enabling more data to be included in a more efficient way.¬†
‚ÄúBitcoin Core‚Äôs next release will, by default, relay and mine transactions whose OP_RETURN outputs exceed 80 bytes and allow any number of these outputs,‚Äù read the announcement on GitHub by Bitcoin developer Greg Sanders on May 5.¬†
The long-standing limit was originally a ‚Äúgentle signal that block space should be used sparingly for non-payment proof of publication data,‚Äù has outlived its utility, he added.¬†
The proposal (PR 32359) was created by Bitcoin pioneer Peter Todd at the request of Chaincode Labs.¬†
OP_RETURN is a special type of Bitcoin (BTC) transaction output that allows storing small amounts of data on the blockchain,‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin Core to unilaterally remove controversial OP-Return limit

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Stephen Katte
articles.description:
Alex Mashinsky, the founder and former CEO of bankrupt crypto lending platform Celsius, has blasted the government's 20-year ‚Äúvenom-laced‚Äù sentence request, declaring it a ‚Äúdeath-in-prison sentence.‚Äù
The US Department of Justice requested Mashinsky receive at least 20 years behind bars in the May 8 sentencing for his role in misleading Celsius users and profiting from the price manipulation of Celsius (CEL), which would make the 59-year-old 79 if he serves the whole sentence.
Lawyers acting for Mashinsky argued in a May 5 reply memorandum filed in a New York district court that he should receive no more than 366 days, because the DOJ hasn't taken into account his status as a nonviolent first-time offender with a previously unblemished 30-year history in business.¬†¬†
‚ÄúThe government's venom-‚Ä¶
articles.title: Celsius‚Äô Mashinsky lashes out at ‚Äòdeath-in-prison sentence‚Äô

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Jesse Coghlan
articles.description:
The Israel-based eToro Group says it‚Äôs looking for a valuation of up to $4 billion with its initial public offering in the US, as the stock and crypto trading platform forges ahead with listing on the Nasdaq.
The company and existing stockholders are aiming to raise $500 million through offering a total of 10 million shares priced between $46 to $50 apiece, eToro said on May 5.
A filing with the US Securities and Exchange Commission shows eToro is offering 5 million shares, with a further 5 million being put up by the likes of the company‚Äôs co-founder and CEO, Yoni Assia; his brother and executive director, Ronen Assia; along with venture firms Spark Capital, BRM Group and Andalusian Private Capital, among others.
The company offers stock and crypto trading targeting retail and plans to li‚Ä¶
articles.title: eToro aims for $4B valuation, $500M raise for US IPO

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
A Russian-Israeli citizen allegedly involved in the $190 million Nomad bridge hack will soon be extradited to the US after he was reportedly arrested at an Israeli airport while boarding a flight to Russia.¬†
Alexander Gurevich will be investigated for his alleged involvement in several ‚Äúcomputer crimes,‚Äù including laundering millions of dollars and transferring stolen property allegedly connected to the Nomad Bridge hack in 2022, The Jerusalem Post reported on May 5.
Gurevich returned to Israel from an overseas trip on April 19 but was ordered to appear before the Jerusalem District Court for an extradition hearing soon after, according to the report.¬†
On April 29, Gurevich changed his name in Israel‚Äôs Population Registry to ‚ÄúAlexander Block‚Äù and received a passport under that name at Isra‚Ä¶
articles.title: Suspect in $190M Nomad hack to be extradited to the US: Report

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
Two Florida crypto bills have been removed from the legislative process in the latest blow to American state-level strategic Bitcoin reserve ambitions.¬†
Florida‚Äôs House Bill 487 and Senate Bill 550 have been ‚Äúindefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration‚Äù on May 3, according to the Florida Senate.¬†
Florida‚Äôs legislative session adjourned on May 2 without the passage of these two bills, which would have advanced legislation to establish a crypto reserve for the state. The Senate and House agreed to extend the session until June 6 to address budget plans.¬†
Lawmakers passed about 230 bills during the session, dealing with things like prohibiting putting fluoride in the water, protecting state parks, and a school smartphone ban, but diversifying state treasury portfolios was not amon‚Ä¶
articles.title: Florida takes strategic Bitcoin reserve bills off the table

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Stephen Katte
articles.description:
A hacker who took over the Tron DAO X account is estimated to have made around $45,000 in improperly solicited funds, according to a spokesperson from Tron.¬†
Speaking to Cointelegraph, the Tron public relations team confirmed that on May 2, the Tron DAO account posted a contract address and sent direct messages to solicit payments in exchange for promotional advertising on the Tron account.
‚ÄúOur security team quickly identified the intrusion and cut off access to the hacker, but we ask the community to continue to be vigilant. We will never ask anyone for payments like this via DM or otherwise,‚Äù they said.¬†
The team said that based on the illicit contract address the hacker posted, the amount improperly solicited appeared to be around $45,000.¬†
Asked whether the same hacker could be respon‚Ä¶
articles.title: Tron says DAO X hack cost victims $45K, Curve Finance also hit

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
The Tron network has drawn closer to regaining the lead from Ethereum in Tether circulation after another big mint by the US stablecoin issuer.
On May 5, Tether minted another $1 billion Tether (USDT) on the Tron network, according to Arkham Intelligence. This brings the total USDT on Tron to $71.4 billion, according to the Tether Transparency report.¬†
In comparison, there is currently $72.8 billion USDT circulating on the Ethereum network, so just $1.4 billion more USDT on Tron will see it become the leading network for the world‚Äôs largest stablecoin issuer, as it has been previously over the last two years.¬†
Tron was ahead of Ethereum for USDT circulation between July 2022 and November 2024, but a large $18 billion mint on Ethereum pushed the network ahead again, according to CryptoQuant‚Ä¶
articles.title: Fresh $1B in Tether mints on Tron, closing gap again with Ethereum

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
The new ‚ÄúDigital Asset Market Structure Discussion Draft‚Äù introduced by House Republicans on May 5 could work to reduce the dominance of large crypto firms and promote more participation in the broader market, according to an executive from Paradigm.¬†
The discussion draft, led by the House agricultural and financial services committee chairs Glenn Thompson and French Hill, is an ‚Äúincremental, albeit meaningful, rewrite‚Äù of the Financial Innovation and Technology for the 21st Century Act (FIT21), Paradigm‚Äôs vice president of regulatory affairs Justin Slaughter said in a May 5 X post.
One-pager of the digital asset market structure discussion draft submitted by House Republicans on May 5. Source: US House Agriculture Committee

One of the major changes from FIT21 is that the draft defines an‚Ä¶
articles.title: New crypto bill draft seen to curb big crypto firm influence

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Jesse Coghlan
articles.description:
Samourai Wallet‚Äôs lawyers allege federal prosecutors suppressed advice that the firm didn‚Äôt need a license before they charged executives at the crypto mixing service months later.¬†
In a May 5 letter to a Manhattan federal court, lawyers for Samourai co-founders Keonne Rodriguez and William Hill said prosecutors disclosed that the US Treasury Department‚Äôs Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) representatives told them six months before they charged the pair ‚Äúthat under FinCEN‚Äôs guidance, the Samourai Wallet app would not qualify as a ‚ÄòMoney Services Business‚Äô requiring a FinCEN license.‚Äù
‚ÄúShockingly, six months later, the same prosecutors criminally charged Keonne Rodriguez and William Hill with operating just such a business without a FinCEN license,‚Äù the lawyers added.
The letter‚Ä¶
articles.title: Samourai Wallet says feds hid advice that crypto mixer was in the clear

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Turner Wright
articles.description:
Acting US Attorney for the Eastern District of New York (EDNY) John Durham has departed as President Donald Trump‚Äôs pick takes control of the office.
In a May 5 notice, the US Attorney‚Äôs Office for EDNY said Joseph Nocella will serve as interim US Attorney for the region for 120 days or until a Senate-confirmed nominee assumes the role. Nocella‚Äôs appointment came as jury selection began in the criminal trial of Braden John Karony, the former CEO of crypto firm SafeMoon.
It‚Äôs unclear how the advancement of Nocella, appointed by US President Donald Trump this month, could affect prosecutors‚Äô case against Karony, who faces charges of securities fraud conspiracy, wire fraud conspiracy, and money laundering conspiracy. Nocella said he intended to help prosecute ‚Äúnarcotics-traffickers, gang memb‚Ä¶
articles.title: New York district gets interim US Attorney as ex-SafeMoon CEO trial kicks off

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Cointelegraph
articles.description:
Today in crypto, Florida has withdrawn its two Bitcoin reserve bills from consideration in a blow to Bitcoin hopefuls, asset manager VanEck has filed for the first US BNB exchange-traded fund and Tether CEO Paolo Ardoino unveiled a new AI platform with crypto payment support.
Florida takes strategic Bitcoin reserve bills off the table
Two Florida crypto bills have been removed from the legislative process in the latest blow to American state-level strategic Bitcoin reserve ambitions.¬†
Florida‚Äôs House Bill 487 and Senate Bill 550 have been ‚Äúindefinitely postponed and withdrawn from consideration‚Äù on May 3, according to the Florida Senate.¬†
State strategic Bitcoin reserve legislation race. Source:¬†Bitcoin Laws
Florida‚Äôs legislative session adjourned on May 2 without the passage of these two ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Here‚Äôs what happened in crypto today

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Alex O‚ÄôDonnell
articles.description:
ChatGPT-maker OpenAI has abandoned plans to become a for-profit company and reaffirmed commitment to its nonprofit status.¬†
In a May 5 blog post, OpenAI confirmed plans to convert its for-profit business unit into a so-called Public Benefit Corporation (PBC), which would remain under the nonprofit‚Äôs control. PBCs are for-profit companies that are legally obligated to prioritize a social mission alongside the interests of shareholders. 
The plans mark a reversal for OpenAI, which had previously floated a for-profit conversion involving spinning out the nonprofit entity. 
‚ÄúOpenAI was founded as a nonprofit, and is today overseen and controlled by that nonprofit. Going forward, it will continue to be overseen and controlled by that nonprofit,‚Äù the ChatGPT-maker said.¬†
This can be done without‚Ä¶
articles.title: OpenAI to stay nonprofit, scrap proposed overhaul

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Christopher Tepedino
articles.description:
The Securities and Exchange Commission‚Äôs (SEC) enforcement approach on crypto firms has left a lasting ‚Äúregulatory overhang‚Äù within the industry, according to Devin Finzer, co-founder and CEO of OpenSea.¬†
Speaking to Cointelegraph, Finzer said that during Biden's administration the agency unfairly targeted good actors in the crypto space, including OpenSea. ‚ÄúThere's all sorts of digital assets, you know, you shouldn't treat them all the same. That's obvious. But I think the approach that the prior SEC was taking was kind of this, you know, very, very generic.‚Äù
The SEC issued a Wells notice ‚Äî a formal notification that is often a precursor to enforcement action ‚Äî to OpenSea in 2024, alleging that the NFT marketplace was operating as an exchange for unregistered securities. At the time, Finz‚Ä¶
articles.title: Good actors were ‚Äòunfairly targeted‚Äô by SEC ‚Äî OpenSea's CEO

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Turner Wright
articles.description:
US President Donald Trump‚Äôs crypto businesses are drawing increased scrutiny on Capitol Hill and beginning to influence the progress of US digital asset legislation. As Republican lawmakers in the US House of Representatives unveiled their draft of a digital asset market structure bill on May 5, Democrats prepared for a united response to Donald Trump‚Äôs deepening connections with the industry.
Speaking to Cointelegraph on May 5, a Democratic staffer with knowledge of the matter said that House Financial Services Committee Ranking Member Maxine Waters planned to lead some members of her party out of a Republican-led hearing discussing digital assets. 
The May 6 hearing, entitled ‚ÄúAmerican Innovation and the Future of Digital Assets‚Äù and led by Committee Chair French Hill, could address draf‚Ä¶
articles.title: Trump‚Äôs crypto dealings face scrutiny as House Republicans unveil digital asset bill

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Marcel Pechman
articles.description:
Key takeaways:

Bitcoin price slips, but BTC dominance is on the rise.

Sizable purchases by Strategy and the spot BTC ETFs highlight institutional investors‚Äô appetite for Bitcoin.

Bitcoin‚Äôs (BTC) price has dropped by 4.3% in the last three days after nearly reaching $97,900 on May 2. Despite showing resilience at the $94,000 level on May 5, some traders are disappointed that strong institutional inflows have not been enough to maintain bullish momentum. However, several encouraging signs suggest that a new all-time high for Bitcoin in 2025 remains within reach.
Bitcoin market share excluding stablecoins. Source: TradingView / Cointelegraph
Bitcoin‚Äôs dominance over the broader cryptocurrency market has surged, currently standing at 70%, its highest since January 2021. This has occurred de‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin sell-off to $93.5K is a brief hiccup ‚Äî Data still supports new BTC highs in 2025

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Christopher Tepedino
articles.description:
The United States Department of the Treasury has sanctioned a Myanmar militia group known as the Karen National Army (KNA), accusing it of crypto-related scams and other criminal activities. 
According to a May 5 press release issued by the agency, the Karen National Army has been orchestrating a variety of crypto scams, including the infamous ‚Äúpig butchering‚Äù scam, which lures victims into contributing more and more to fake crypto schemes. Americans ‚Äúhave collectively lost billions of dollars‚Äù from scams such as those emanating from Myanmar, the release reads, without specifying an amount.
‚ÄúToday, the U.S. Department of the Treasury‚Äôs Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) sanctioned the¬†Karen National Army¬†(KNA), a militia group in Burma, as a transnational criminal organization, along ‚Ä¶
articles.title: US Treasury sanctions Myanmar militia group for alleged crypto scams

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Alex O‚ÄôDonnell
articles.description:
Asset manager VanEck has asked US regulators for permission to list an exchange-traded fund (ETF) holding BNB, the native token of Binance‚Äôs BNB Chain, regulatory filings show.¬†
The ETF is designed to accumulate spot BNB (BNB) tokens and ‚Äúmay, from time to time, stake a portion of the [fund‚Äôs] assets through one or more trusted staking providers,‚Äù according to the ETF‚Äôs S-1 prospectus.¬†The filing marks the first time an asset manager has filed for a BNB ETF in the United States.
The BNB token has a market capitalization of roughly $84 billion, according to data from CoinMarketCap. As of May 5, BNB stakers earn a yield of approximately 2.5%, according to data from Stakingrewards.com.¬†
Binance‚Äôs BNB Chain is among the most popular smart contract networks, with a total value locked (TVL) of n‚Ä¶
articles.title: VanEck files for BNB ETF, first in US

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Turner Wright
articles.description:
Crypto users are weighing in as Alex Mashinsky, the former CEO of Celsius Network, prepares to stand before a judge on May 8 to face sentencing for commodities fraud and a fraudulent scheme to manipulate the price of the platform‚Äôs token.
In a May 2 filing in the US District Court for the Southern District of New York (SDNY), prosecutors released several impact statements from individuals affected by the collapse of Celsius filed after the initial deadline. Though at least one suggested clemency for the former CEO, many told the court about the financial and personal losses caused by the crypto firm filing for bankruptcy, and hinted that Mashinsky should be held accountable for misrepresenting the company.
‚ÄúMany of the people who participated in this fraud, benefited from this fraud, and p‚Ä¶
articles.title: What do crypto users want to happen to Alex Mashinsky?

November 2024 - April 2025
